quizName: NCLEX Quiz - Reduction of Risk Potential

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a nursing intervention to prevent falls in a healthcare setting?
options: Administer sedatives to keep patients calm
Keep the environment well-lit and free of clutter
Encourage patients to walk independently
Place patients in restraints
questions.answer: Keep the environment well-lit and free of clutter
questions.explanation: Keeping the environment well-lit and free of clutter is an important nursing intervention to prevent falls in a healthcare setting. It helps improve visibility and reduces tripping hazards, promoting patient safety.

questions.question: True or False: Hand hygiene is an important measure to prevent healthcare-associated infections.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: Hand hygiene is a crucial measure to prevent healthcare-associated infections. Proper handwashing or use of hand sanitizers helps eliminate or reduce the transmission of pathogens.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent pressure ulcers?
options: Keeping the patient in the same position for an extended period
Providing regular repositioning and turning
Using tight-fitting linens and clothing
Avoiding the use of pressure-relieving devices
questions.explanation: Providing regular repositioning and turning is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent pressure ulcers. It helps relieve pressure on specific areas of the body and improves blood circulation, reducing the risk of developing pressure ulcers.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a patient safety measure to prevent medication errors?
options: Administering medications without verifying the patient's identity
Administering medications without checking for allergies
Using abbreviations and acronyms in medication orders
Using barcode scanning for medication administration
questions.answer: Using barcode scanning for medication administration
questions.explanation: Using barcode scanning for medication administration is an example of a patient safety measure to prevent medication errors. It helps ensure that the right medication is given to the right patient by scanning the barcode on the medication package and matching it with the patient's identification.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent the spread of infectious diseases?
options: Avoiding hand hygiene practices
Reusing single-use medical equipment
Covering the mouth and nose with hands during coughing or sneezing

Wearing personal

 protective equipment (PPE) when necessary
questions.answer: Wearing personal protective equipment (PPE) when necessary
questions.explanation: Wearing personal protective equipment (PPE) when necessary is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent the spread of infectious diseases. PPE includes gloves, masks, gowns, and goggles, and it helps protect both the healthcare provider and the patient from potential transmission of pathogens.

questions.question: True or False: Restraints should be used as a first-line intervention to manage agitated or confused patients.
options: True
False
questions.explanation: Restraints should not be used as a first-line intervention to manage agitated or confused patients. They should only be used as a last resort when all other less restrictive measures have been ineffective in ensuring patient and staff safety.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent surgical site infections?
options: Using sterile technique during wound dressing changes
Delaying ambulation after surgery
Avoiding preoperative antibiotic prophylaxis
Using contaminated instruments during surgery
questions.answer: Using sterile technique during wound dressing changes
questions.explanation: Using sterile technique during wound dressing changes is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent surgical site infections. It helps minimize the introduction of pathogens into the surgical site and promotes healing.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a nursing intervention to prevent aspiration during feeding?
options: Positioning the patient in a supine position
Feeding the patient quickly to save time
Using a small-gauge feeding tube
Elevating the head of the bed during feeding
questions.answer: Elevating the head of the bed during feeding
questions.explanation: Elevating the head of the bed during feeding is an example of a nursing intervention to prevent aspiration. It helps promote proper swallowing and digestion by reducing the risk of food or liquid entering the airway.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent healthcare-associated infections related to urinary catheterization?
options: Leaving the catheter bag on the floor
Emptying the catheter bag when it is full
Removing the catheter as soon as possible
Maintaining a closed urinary drainage system
questions.answer: Maintaining a closed urinary drainage system
questions.explanation: Maintaining a closed urinary drainage system is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent healthcare-associated infections related to urinary catheterization. It helps minimize the entry of pathogens into the urinary tract and reduces the risk of infection.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent complications of immobility?
options: Encouraging regular exercise and physical activity
Restricting fluid intake to prevent incontinence
Leaving the patient in a sitting position for extended periods
Using a hard mattress for the patient's bed
questions.answer: Encouraging regular exercise and physical activity
questions.explanation: Encouraging regular exercise and physical activity is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent complications of immobility. It helps maintain muscle strength, joint flexibility, and overall physical health, reducing the risk of complications such as muscle atrophy and pressure ulcers.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent surgical errors?
options: Skipping the surgical time-out process
Performing multiple surgical procedures simultaneously
Counting surgical instruments and sponges before and after surgery
Administering medications without verifying the patient's identity
questions.answer: Counting surgical instruments and sponges before and after surgery
questions.explanation: Counting surgical instruments and sponges before and after surgery is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent surgical errors. It helps ensure that all instruments and sponges are accounted for and prevents the unintentional retention of foreign objects in the patient's body.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent complications of blood transfusion?
options: Infusing the blood transfusion rapidly
Using a large-gauge needle for blood transfusion
Administering medications without checking the patient's blood type
Monitoring the patient for any signs of transfusion reaction
questions.answer: Monitoring the patient for any signs of transfusion reaction
questions.explanation: Monitoring the patient for any signs of transfusion reaction is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent complications of blood transfusion. It allows for early detection and prompt intervention in case of any adverse reactions or complications.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in immobilized patients?
options: Encouraging frequent ambulation and leg exercises
Keeping the patient's legs in a dependent position
Using tight stockings that constrict blood flow
Administering sedatives to promote rest and immobility
questions.answer: Encouraging frequent ambulation and leg exercises
questions.explanation: Encouraging frequent ambulation and leg exercises is an appropriate nursing intervention to prevent deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in immobilized patients. It helps promote blood circulation and prevents the formation of blood clots in the lower extremities.
